sections.title: Overview
sections.content: A smart pill dispenser built using an STM32 microcontroller to help patients take the correct medicine at the correct time and reduce medication mistakes.

sections.title: Problem
sections.content: Elderly patients often forget to take medicine or take it more than once. In hospitals, manual medicine handling also increases staff workload and risk of errors.

sections.title: Solution
sections.content: Designed and programmed an automated pill dispensing system that releases medicine based on a schedule and confirms dispensing using sensors.

sections.title: Key Features
items: OLED and LCD display for user feedback

sections.title: My Role
items: Designed system logic and firmware flow
Integrated RFID, sensors, servo motor, and RTC
Tested dispensing accuracy and system reliability

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: A self-checkout system combining an IoT kiosk with a web backend to reduce queue time and improve checkout efficiency in supermarkets.

sections.title: Problem
sections.content: Traditional staffed checkout counters create long queues and require more manpower during peak hours.

sections.title: Solution
sections.content: Built a kiosk that allows customers to scan items and manage their cart locally, then sync data to a web backend for payment and receipt handling.

sections.title: Key Features
items: Item scanning and cart management on kiosk
Cart data synced with web application
Support for offline and online operation

sections.title: My Role
items: Performed on-site troubleshooting for kiosk hardware
Monitored system health and deployment stability
Coordinated integration testing between kiosk and web system
